page.title: 16ROSEHILL SCHOOL, RAWMARSH
page.content: Our school was built in 1911 and is built of red brick. It is the largest primary school in Rawmarsh, this means it has the largest number of children. It used to have eight classrooms round the hall but now it has only seven. In the mid 1960s extensions were built on. They were the indoor toilets, the headmaster's office, the medical office and two more classrooms. One of the original classrooms was converted into a P.E. equipment area. There have been three headmasters since 1911. They were Mr. Ingham, Mr. Bedford and Mr. Branston. Our present headmaster has been here since 1965, which is just 20 years. In the year ending July, 1985 there are two first year, two second year, two third year and three fourth year classes. This year 72 fourth year pupils are leaving to go to three comprehensive schools.
